title: Al Qaeda serif newspaper headline
content:
Would you ID this font name is?  
Thanks

 [‹ (x) Viva Tequeria & Tequila Bar script - Coronet {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204115313/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32959 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Crosstown Rebels geometric sans - ITC Avant Garde Gothic w/ Alt {Mili Carr} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204115313/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32951 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wedbanz

comments.content: Which newspaper is this from? I believe this is a custom designed newspaper headline face, possibly The Font Bureau, Inc. or Hoefler & Frere-Jones or something like that.

it was the Q that i kept looking at... most bodonis don’t have a tail like that, but this one does

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/bodoni/bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204115313/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/bodoni/bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/bodoni/bold/")

in fact, there are a lot of similarities in the general form

This is no didone. The serifs are bracketed. It’s more of an English Modern or Scotch, like [Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20081204115313/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/miller_display_roman/&sample_text=Al%20Qaeda&sample_size=90) .
